list.os_requirements: Requires iOSÂ 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- Automatic time zone detection can now be found through Settings -> Advanced -> Set Time Zone Automatically; so even if your brain is in another time zone, your app wonâ€™t be. 
- Fixed: Users would sometimes get signed out of all teams unexpectedly. This should at least be partially fixed, but may still occur in some rare edge cases (and weâ€™re sorry for that). 
- Fixed: When trying to â€œSort by most relevantâ€ the app would sometimes crash, somehow mistaking â€œmost relevantâ€ for â€œleast convenient.â€ 
- Fixed: Some commonly-encountered crashes when connecting or loading messages are no longer as common. 
- Fixed: No thanks are required for the fact image files should no longer get uploaded with a .null extension. It was nothing.
list.description:
All your team communication in one place. A new way to get more done, spend less time in meetings, and reduce email. Thatâ€™s Slack.

- Real time messaging and file sharing for one-to-one and group conversations
- Powerful search and archiving, so you can find information easily
- Hundreds of integrations with apps and services including Dropbox, Asana, Google Drive, Twitter, Zendesk and more
- Instantly syncs across all devices
- Configurable notifications for desktop, mobile, and email
- Scientifically proven (or at least rumored) to make your working life simpler, more pleasant, and more productive

Slack is available for free for as long as you want, with upgradeable plans for increased membership, extended message history, unlimited integrations, file storage and customizable data retention policies.

"There are two types of people in the world: those who have never heard of Slack, and those who canâ€™t imagine life without it." 
â€” The Guardian

"Can't praise it enough. Slack transformed the way we work together at The New York Times.â€ 
â€” Michael Villasenor, Creative Director, The New York Times

Find out what our customers are saying at twitter.com/slacklovetweets.

â€” Michael Villasenor, Creative Director, The New York Times

list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- Tweaks so tiny theyâ€™re barely worth mentioning, and bug fixes that are nigh on impossible to describe.
- So: Minor improvements and bug fixes, basically.
- We knew this day would come.

list.os_requirements: Requires iOSÂ 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- Performance improvements to make the Slack app launch more zippily. 
- For VoiceOver users, the three-finger swipe up/down gestures were fixed. A swipe up gesture scrolls the messages down, and a swipe down scrolls messages up. As it should be.
- iPad Quick Switcher design tweaks â€” which serves as a useful reminder that when using an external keyboard, the Quick Switcher is just a cmd+k away, just like on desktop.
- Support for the cmd + shift + k keyboard shortcut to quickly start a new DM.
- Fixed: When previewing a channel the â€œJoin Channelâ€ button was sometimes befuddlingly absent. You are no longer trapped on the outside looking in. 
- Fixed: When tapping a channel from your Channel List, a malicious hex meant the wrong background color was sometimes displayed, causing possible emotional distress in the design community. All hues are correct; all creative souls salved. 
- Fixed: Changes to DND schedule that you initiate on desktop will now automatically sync, as you might have always expected.
- Fixed: VoiceOver will now properly indicate whether a selected channel is public or private.
- Fixed: A left flick from the upload button now moves the VoiceOver focus to the newest message, as opposed to the oldest. Which caused the app to load even more old messages... It wasnâ€™t great, letâ€™s not talk about it again.
- Fixed: Also, when using VoiceOver, weâ€™ll now indicate your current channel when the navigation bar is tapped. 
- Fixed: Typing /open followed by a channel name now works correctly with private channels. Which is to say â€œit opens the private channel you mentionâ€ (and who knew THAT was a thing?!). 
- Fixed: The app would sometimes crash when trying to open a userâ€™s profile. It wasnâ€™t them being mysterious. It was software being a bit rubbish. Everything is better now.

list.os_requirements: Requires iOSÂ 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- The Team Switcher has been updated so itâ€™s even nicer than before. 
- Fixed: A crash which could occur in the Quick Switcher, meaning that it would sometimes quickly and quietly crash, has been fixed. It now defers to plain old switching, instead. 
- Fixed: There was formerly too much spacing between lines in block quotes and pre blocks. Now itâ€™s just right.
- Fixed: We now allow users to invite bots to your #general channel (or to whatever youâ€™ve renamed your #general channel). 
- Fixed: The left side of emoji reactions are no longer clipped. Phew, eh?
- Fixed: Youâ€™re now able to scroll properly through file comments, even long comments, because some comments are important and long, but now you can do it even if the comments in question are, for some reason, really quite ridiculously over-exaggeratedly, sometimes pointlessly, repetitively, over-verbosely long. Even if youâ€™re questioning whether you wanted this fixed by the time you reach the end, it is fixed. TL;DR, you can scroll through all the comments, all the way to the end, no matter how long they are. If thatâ€™s the kind of thing you like to do. And thank you for doing it.

list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- Fixed: A rare but ill-befitting crash that would happen in the middle of sending a message. The act of sending of messages now has a fitting beginning, middle and
- Fixed: If the message text size was increased (Settings --> Accessibility --> Message Text Size) sometimes the timestamps of messages were cut off. They are not, now (or â€œthenâ€, depending on what the timestamp was).
- Fixed: Some folk were not able to enable push notifications, no matter how hard they tried. Now you should always be able to enable push notifications by opening the app and going to Settings --> Push Notifications. To those people: weâ€™re sorry. That was annoying.
- Fixed: iPad users are now 100% able to use external keyboard arrows to navigate the quick switcher. Up from 0%, so thatâ€™s quite the increase!!!
list.os_requirements: Requires iOSÂ 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.

list.os_requirements: Requires iOSÂ 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.whatsnew:
- A delightful new team switcher and a more attractive sidebar have been added. Swipe right once for the channel list, and now, swipe right again to change teams entirely. Swipe left to edit your profile, change settings, and look at your own face. Because you look nice today. 
- The Quick Switcher is better, and smarter, and swifter at switching.
- A preference has finally arrived to disable all animated images, including emoji and reacji. You can find it in Settings --> Accessibility --> Disable Animated Images. Take that, parrot.

- Fixed: Uploading an image file should, cross fingers, no longer cause the app to crash.
- Fixed: A missing VoiceOver label on the Quick Switcher has been put in its rightful place. 
- Fixed: When opening a new DM you can now search by both first and last name with a space in between, because thatâ€™s how names work.
- Fixed: Editing a message after the â€œedit message windowâ€ has expired no longer fails silently. 
- Fixed: Extra # no longer displayed next to channel name when jumping to the message archive from Pinned Items. 
- Fixed: A nefarious bug in the emoji picker resulted in a mischievous misplacement of emoji. No more.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication

list.os_requirements: Requires iOSÂ 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- *Dinky little placeholders in the message input field to help remind you which channel or conversation youâ€™re about to send a message in. Just in case youâ€™ve landed in the wrong one. Somehow.
- Performance improvements for faster and more pleasant connecting. 
- Fixes for a few of our most frequent and fetid crashes.
- Shareable invites: If you have permission to invite new users to your team, you can now easily share an invite link with others by going to the right side menu and tapping the â€œInviteâ€ button.  

- Fixed: Youâ€™d sometimes get totally trapped after tapping an avatar to open a profile. Apparently you wanted to see the profile, but not infinitely and to the exclusion of all else. Fine.
- Fixed: In Recent Mentions, previously unreadable by screen readers, VoiceOver now reads your messages, just as it should.
- Fixed: If you noticed while navigating the Settings screen the back arrow was missing, itâ€™s now back.
- Fixed: When opening a DM from the Quick Switcher it would sometimes kick you to #general. This was potentially #awkward, and precisely the type of situation you might wantâ€¦ 
(please read from *)

list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- Performance improvements and a coating of butter mean messages slip through the sky and load to your phone far faster.
- Fixed: URLs with colons were breaking: they are no longer. 
- Fixed: No more will the rendering of a few new emoji cause Slack to get stuck in a petulant crash loop. The emoji render; the app loads; the people feel happy; the world is at peace.

list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- OH! Hi. We were justâ€¦ umâ€¦ OK, fine: You can now preview channels before joining them, just like on desktop. Awkward entrances begone. 
- The experience of uploading images is a more pleasant and downright simpler one.
- Jumping to a message from your Recent Mentions is now simpler too.
- And the new invite flow when inviting new users to your team is, we think, gosh-darned delightful. 
- If Reduce Motion is enabled in your device settings, we now automagically disable the flip animation when switching teams. Support for disabling more animations on the way. 
- For VoiceOver users, updated labels include the number of unread mentions in a channel and indicate the starred & pinned messages to allow for a fuller picture.
- Also, better VoiceOver support and labeling for the Quick Switcher and channel settings.
- Support added for the VoiceOver scrub gesture â€” so drawing a Z with 2 fingers will close side menus. OR leave your phone with the mark of Zorro. Could go either way. 
- New welcome area in @slackbot, with shortcuts to Edit Profile and Add Apps & Bots.
- Long press on any message for a "Remind Me" option, and be reminded of whatever it was in that message that you wanted reminding of, after whatever interval you chose to be reminded of it! Itâ€™s simpler AND far more useful than that sentence made it sound.
- Performance improvements make for faster channel switching, zippier launch times, and less freezing. Itâ€™s pretty hot.

- Fixed: Private channels that youâ€™d left on web or desktop still occasionally, and maddeningly, appeared on iOS. Theyâ€™re now gone. Paf. 
- Fixed: Attempting to /leave in #general (or your teamâ€™s equivalent, if itâ€™s been renamed) no longer fails silently. Make no mistakeâ€¦ it still fails. But now it has a message about why, and an option to mute the channel. 
- Fixed: We now respect the â€œCollapse All Imagesâ€ pref for all images, as the words â€œall imagesâ€ suggested to begin with. 
- Fixed: iOS 10 users should no longer have an empty Channel List when launching the app.  
- Fixed: The app no longer freezes when using keyboard shortcuts for the quick switcher and search.
- Fixed: The number of loading spinners appearing when loading messages in a channel have been reduced in number from a frankly ridiculous two to a far more rational one. 
- Fixed: Custom emojis in bot avatars now display correctly.
- Fixed: The â€œadd reactionâ€ button would disappear when there was a full row of reactions. 
- Fixed: There would sometimes be a little too much padding below a row of reactions. Apologies if you had been previously using that space to imagine tiny reactions on the reactions, and perhaps tinier reactions on the reactions to the reactions. It is not to be.

- OH! Hi. We were justâ€¦ umâ€¦ OK, fine: You can now preview channels before joining them, just like on desktop. Awkward entrances begone. 
- The experience of uploading images is a more pleasant and downright simpler one.
- Jumping to a message from your Recent Mentions is now simpler too.
- And the new invite flow when inviting new users to your team is, we think, gosh-darned delightful. 
- If Reduce Motion is enabled in your device settings, we now automagically disable the flip animation when switching teams. Support for disabling more animations on the way. 
- For Voiceover users, updated labels include the number of unread mentions in a channel and indicate the starred & pinned messages to allow for a fuller picture.
- Also, better VoiceOver support and labeling for the Quick Switcher and channel settings.
- Support added for the VoiceOver scrub gesture â€” so drawing a Z with 2 fingers will close side menus. OR leave your phone with the mark of Zorro. Could go either way. 
- New welcome area in @slackbot, with shortcuts to Edit Profile and Add Apps & Bots.
- Long press on any message for a "Remind Me" option, and be reminded of whatever it was in that message that you wanted reminding of, after whatever interval you chose to be reminded of it! Itâ€™s simpler AND far more useful than that sentence made it sound.
- Performance improvements make for faster channel switching, zippier launch times, and less freezing. Itâ€™s pretty hot.

- Fixed: Private channels that youâ€™d left on web or desktop still occasionally, and maddeningly, appeared on iOS. Theyâ€™re now gone. Paf. 
- Fixed: Attempting to /leave in #general (or your teamâ€™s equivalent, if itâ€™s been renamed) no longer fails silently. Make no mistakeâ€¦ it still fails. But now it has a message about why, and an option to mute the channel. 
- Fixed: We now respect the â€œCollapse All Imagesâ€ pref for all images, as the words â€œall imagesâ€ suggested to begin with. 
- Fixed: iOS 10 users should no longer have an empty Channel List when launching the app.  
- Fixed: The app no longer freezes when using keyboard shortcuts for the quick switcher and search.
- Fixed: The number of loading spinners appearing when loading messages in a channel have been reduced in number from a frankly ridiculous two to a far more rational one. 
- Fixed: Custom emojis in bot avatars now display correctly.
- Fixed: The â€œadd reactionâ€ button would disappear when there was a full row of reactions. 
- Fixed: There would sometimes be a little too much padding below a row of reactions. Apologies if you had been previously using that space to imagine tiny reactions on the reactions, and perhaps tinier reactions on the reactions to the reactions. It is not to be.

list.whatsnew:
- Fixed: Where single-channel guests whose single channel was #general could not send messages in the one channel they were in (#general), they now can (#generally). Sorry about this. 
- Fixed: The Watch app icon is now the correct App Store icon once again. And not the blue beta one. Which is a lovely icon. But not the right thing.
- And thatâ€™s all! Just two things (they just happened to be particularly annoying things).

Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- For users of VoiceOver, reactions are now read out, and thereâ€™s better support for the Settings screen, file comments, and in the Starred Items section. Weâ€™re sorry itâ€™s taken so long, VoiceOver users â€” more is on the way in this and other areas of accessibility soon. Thanks again for your patience.
- We redesigned the channel settings. Theyâ€™re lovelier now than we ever dreamed possible. 
- The intro text you see in new channels and DMs has been rewritten to better explain where you are, and who youâ€™re talking to. What youâ€™re talking to them about, meanwhile, is up to you.

- Fixed: With VoiceOver enabled, the â€œConnectedâ€ message would be read out every time users launched the app. It was disruptive, suboptimal, and no longer happens.  
- Fixed: Starred Items now include starred comments. Given that they, too, are starred.
- Fixed: Starred Items now load faster and show all your starred items, rather than just the first 200. Which is useful forâ€¦ weâ€™re not sure. Regardless, it works now.
- Fixed: Where background app refresh would sometimes fail to update messages in your last active channel, it now doesnâ€™t (fail) and does (update).
- Fixed: Two of our most frequently encountered crashes which occurred when connecting no longer occur at that point. Occasionally you may still encounter a crash when updating. But it wonâ€™t be one of these crashes. No siree. Itâ€™ll be a different one. 
- Fixed: Duplicate messages would sometimes be sent if you tried to send a message while connecting to your team.
- Fixed: Duplicate messages would sometimes be sent if you tried to send a message while connecting to your teamâ€¦ but now they arenâ€™t.
- Fixed: Better emoji autocomplete so users are more likely to find the emoji they seek.
- Fixed: The â€œFailed Loading Messagesâ€ banner could get stuck on screen, even after re-connecting and loading all of your messages, which was not only distracting: it wasnâ€™t even true.
- Fixed: Tapping the search button crashed the app for iOS 10 users, which was probably not what they were looking for. 
- Fixed: Messages sent by a user would sometimes have the â€œBOTâ€ label, even though it was ostensibly sent by an actual real human (as far as we know).
- Fixed: Users without a first or last name would display as a blank space in the reaction viewer, but will now appear correctly. Basically, if you were a blank space lately, weâ€™ll write your name.
list.description:
All your team communication in one place. A new way to get more done, spend less time in meetings, and reduce email. Thatâ€™s Slack.

- Real time messaging and file sharing for one-to-one and group conversations
- Powerful search and archiving, so you can find information easily
- Hundreds of integrations with apps and services including Dropbox, Asana, Google Drive, Twitter, Zendesk and more
- Instantly syncs across all devices
- Configurable notifications for desktop, mobile, and email
- Scientifically proven (or at least rumored) to make your working life simpler, more pleasant, and more productive

Slack is available for free for as long as you want, with upgradeable plans for increased membership, extended message history, unlimited integrations, file storage and customizable data retention policies.

"There are two types of people in the world: those who have never heard of Slack, and those who canâ€™t imagine life without it." 
â€” The Guardian

"Can't praise it enough. Slack transformed the way we work together at The New York Times.â€ 
â€” Michael Villasenor, Creative Director, The New York Times

Find out what our customers are saying at twitter.com/slacklovetweets.

â€” Michael Villasenor, Creative Director, The New York Times

Find out what our customers are saying at twitter.com/slacklovetweets.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- A complete refactoring of our team-switching code, tweaking things and tidying up and generally making it better in myriad abstruse ways. 
- Calls have improved two-fold, both in quality, and in the quantity of bugs they no longer have.

- Fixed: An error that meant the first comment uploaded with an image was sometimes cut o 
- Fixed: Channel-specific push notification settings now save correctly when changing your settings to be notified by @mentions or highlight words.
- Fixed: Being unable to load older message history in private channels or group messages is now a thing of the past.
- Fixed: Things that are blue, it turns out, better indicate they are a link. Accordingly, attachment titles are now blue. Again.
- Fixed: Long pressing any attachment will now again allow you to do handy things like add reactions, hide the attachment and copy text.
- Fixed: Some links up above (or within) attachments were not tappable. They now are, and you should now feel free to tap them up (or within). 
- Fixed: When using @username autocomplete or searching for a new DM results are now filtered by any word in a userâ€™s name, not just the first and last, because everything is important.
- Fixed: Just because one person exercises questionable judgement, doesnâ€™t mean everyone else should suffer. On that basis, we fixed a crash which could occur when signing into a team where another user had a GIF as their profile image. 
- Fixed: When adding a reaction from the emoji picker the Flags and Symbols icons were mistakenly swapped. We cannot apologize enough.
list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.

list.whatsnew:
- A complete refactoring of our team-switching code makes for a slicker, quicker, altogether more reliable experience of switching teams. 
- Calls have improved two-fold, both in quality, and in the quantity of bugs they no longer have.

- Fixed: An error that meant the first comment uploaded with an image was sometimes cut o 
- Fixed: Channel-specific push notification settings now save correctly when changing your settings to be notified by @mentions or highlight words.
- Fixed: Being unable to load older message history in private channels or group messages is now a thing of the past.
- Fixed: Things that are blue, it turns out, better indicate they are a link. Accordingly, attachment titles are now blue. Again.
- Fixed: Long pressing any attachment will now again allow you to do handy things like add reactions, hide the attachment and copy text.
- Fixed: Some links up above (or within) attachments were not tappable. They now are, and you should now feel free to tap them up (or within). 
- Fixed: When using @username autocomplete or searching for a new DM results are now filtered by any word in a userâ€™s name, not just the first and last, because everything is important.
- Fixed: Just because one person exercises questionable judgement, doesnâ€™t mean everyone else should suffer. On that basis, we fixed a crash which could occur when signing into a team where another user had a GIF as their profile image. 
- Fixed: When adding a reaction from the emoji picker the Flags and Symbols icons were mistakenly swapped. We cannot apologize enough.

list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.whatsnew:
- Fixed: The badge count on the app icon would sometimes not increase when a push notification was received. This is now fixed. Because, after all, the badge count had one job. One.
- Fixed: If youâ€™ve set your team preference so that anyone (not just admins) can invite new users to the team, we now respect that.
- Fixed: Crashes that occasionally occurred when launching the app from a push notification or using keyboard shortcuts to switch channels, are now no more. However occasional, these aberrations could be nose-wrinklingly, bum-clenchingly annoying. Sorry about that.

list.title: Slack - Team Communication

list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.whatsnew:
- Fixed: Tapping a starred message from your Starred Items no longer crashes the app, as this was never the desired behavior of the feature. 
- Fixed: Attachment fields once again respect the `short` field, so you can display short content side-by-side in an attachment rather than vertically. Which was, of course, always the desired behavior of the feature, until we broke it. Sorry about that.
- Fixed: We cleaned up the icons we display next to file upload messages in a channel. They are now far less grubby.

list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.whatsnew:
- Support for Dynamic Type in messages. To adjust your text size go to Settings -> Advanced -> Message Text Size. The font size will be honored for messages throughout the app, with additional support coming soon. We know that this, and other accessibility improvements, have been too long coming. Weâ€™re sorry: more to follow (and faster).  
- A little sprucing up means prettier formatting of unfurls, attachments, etc.
- Calls are now a good deal better, but not quite at the level of â€œhunky doryâ€ yet, so weâ€™ve added a new post-call survey (to find out when they could be hunky-dorier). 
- Performance improvements to zippily load your Channel List. 

- Fixed: Some users, who were being automatically sent to the @slackbot DM when switching teams, are now not. Everybody likes Slackbot, but no one likes Slackbot THAT much.
- Fixed: Audio is no longer only played through the earpiece speaker on your phone.
- Fixed: Date dividers would sometimes not be centered in channels, which wasnâ€™t disastrous, but it sure wasnâ€™t pretty.
- Fixed: Opening the quick switcher with cmd+k on iPad with a bluetooth keyboard no longer crashes the app.  And â€” as a boon â€” if you didnâ€™t before, you now know that cmd+k works on iPad. Boon!
- Fixed: App would sometimes crash when switching teams if your team had a .gif as their team icon. Gifs do not, and should not, display as team icons, because how annoying would that be? 
- Fixed: If you opened a userâ€™s profile from another userâ€™s profile view the back arrow button would, annoyingly, stop working. 
- Fixed: Starred files, which are files that are starred, werenâ€™t being displayed in Starred Items, which was confusing, because thatâ€™s what they were. And they werenâ€™t. Being displayed. But they are now. Confusion over! Right? Great. Glad we cleared that up.

Find out what our customers are saying at twitter.com/slacklovetweets.

list.whatsnew:
- Channel List redesign with a fancy new DM list. Swipe left from the Channel List to view a sorted list of your most recent direct messages or to open a new DM. Also, tap the team icon in the top left corner to jump to the team switcher (you can still use the three finger swipe to change teams, of course). 
- When typing slash commands, the helper text will hang around while you are typing, making it easier to remember what it is that youâ€™re meant to type.
- Improvements to Calls have picked up, and the number of bugs dialed down.
- Performance enhancements related to message formatting.
- Some other dinky but delightful performance improvements designed to make emojis download faster.
- Demystification alert: Youâ€™ll now find emoji names displayed within the reaction viewer. Long press on any reacji to see everyone that has reacted, and what the dickens it was that they reacted with.

- Fixed: We squished a mysterious bug in which reaction cells would sometimes be blank and not show any emoji at all. Hey presto, reacji-o: they do now. 
- Fixed: The message input field should now no longer get stuck in a state of floating with no keyboard below it. Which is good, because that was rubbish.
- Fixed: When adjusting your push notification settings the app would sometimes crash, even though â€œcrashâ€ isnâ€™t in itself a notification, and wasnâ€™t one of the settings available to you.

Find out what our customers are saying at twitter.com/slacklovetweets.
list.whatsnew:
- The Quick Switcher now mirrors the benefits of the desktop version â€” quicker to switch and better at remembering your most recent and most frequent channels.
- We now handle the conversion of Group DMs to Private Channels with a little more dignity, and a great deal more elan.
- File links now come with added auto-auth tokens, allowing you to move swiftly and securely from the app to a mobile browser to view a file without re-authentication (or â€œsigning in againâ€).

- Fixed: A few of our bigger crashers which could occur when loading messages/switching teams. Given that these functions are kind of important, we thought it prudent to clean that up.
- Fixed: For the benefit of all those who have pinned seemingly random messages and confused their team, we now, thankfully, request confirmation before pinning.
- Fixed: In an unfair reflection on your photographic skills, "Use Last Photo Taken" would sometimes upload a poor quality image file. The picture should now be only as poor as the one you took. 
- Fixed: Pleasingly, audio files now continue to play while the app is in the background.
- Fixed: Users were sometimes unable to upload an image file because they were told they didn't have an internet connection. â€œBut I doâ€ you said. Fair enough, we said, we should fix that. And we did.
- Fixed: Tapping the "View Files" button from a user's profile now takes you to their file list, so you can view files theyâ€™ve shared with you or publicly in your team, as you might expect.
- Fixed: 3D touching an email or phone number link would cause the app to think your intent was to reach through the phone and actually caress the face of the other party and, in a fit of awkwardness, would crash the app. Possibly. Whatever the case, itâ€™s now fixed.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.

"There are two types of people in the world: those who have never heard of Slack, and those who canâ€™t imagine life without it." â€” The Guardian

"Can't praise it enough. Slack transformed the way we work together at The New York Times.â€ - Michael Villasenor, Creative Director, The New York Times

Find out what our customers are saying at twitter.com/slacklovetweets.
list.whatsnew:
- You can now 3D Touch on the app icon, channel list, and team directory for shortcuts and to both peek â€‹*and*â€‹ pop. NB: Only available on phones with 3D Touch. We are not responsible for screens in other dimensions.
- Search Assist is now spiffier and speedier, with extra modifiers to better assist your searching. 
- Pinned Items can now be added, removed and, most importantly, viewed while on the move.
- Individual channels can now, mercifully, be muted from their Channel Settings menu.
- In fact, full notifications preferences are now available on iOS, making it easier for everyone to adjust notification levels to suit them, whenever and wherever they like.

- Fixed: You can now long press on items within Starred Items to unstar them, and render them simply â€œItemsâ€, humility is a good thing.
- Fixed: Previously, unacceptably, resending a failed message with a custom emoji broke the custom emoji. We fixed it.
- Fixed: We cleaned up the copy that was displayed when inviting a new user to a channel so the channel name isnâ€™t duplicated because attention to detail is important.
- Fixed: Uploading an image using "Use Last Photo Taken" method was generating duplicates in your camera roll, making the last photo taken the next photo too. It no longer does this.
- Fixed: The message input field was playing peekaboo behind the keyboard if you started a search with the keyboard up. Cute, we told it; but not cool. It stopped immediately.
- Fixed: An underscore in a pinned message is now, logically, displayed as an underscore.
- Fixed: If you tapped a userâ€™s phone number from their profile view sometimes we would only show an option to â€œTextâ€. While this may have salved the introverted souls among us, the option to call, FaceTime, OR text should have always been (and is now) available.
- Fixed: The Quick Switcher now is a bit quicker when searching and swifter when switching.
- One last little big thing: We added support for Jumbomoji. Post a message that contains only emoji (up to 23 of them) and theyâ€™ll come out super-sized (or, at the very least, visible).
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.

list.description:
All your team communication in one place, instantly searchable, available wherever you go. That's Slack.

- Real time messaging, file sharing, supporting one-to-one and group conversations
- Powerful search and archiving, meaning no one is ever left out of the loop
- Dozens of integrations with tools including: Dropbox, Asana, Google+ Hangouts, Twitter, Zendesk
- New integrations and features added frequently
- Inline images and video, with rich link summaries giving context without leaving the app
- Instantly synced across all devices
- Configurable notifications for desktop, mobile push and email
- Scientifically proven (or at least rumored) to make your working life simpler, more pleasant, and more productive

â€œThere are two types of people in the world: those who have never heard of Slack, and those who canâ€™t imagine life without it.â€ - The Guardian

â€œYou can tell that the team that designed it really took their time focusing on the little big details. Itâ€™s simple to use and powerful at the same time.â€ - User Experience Rocks
list.whatsnew:
- Fixed: Some oddly formatted messages had a tendency to cause crash upon crash in a seemingly never-ending loop. We no longer loop nor cause a crash, no matter how oddly-formatted the message.
- Fixed: A horrible habit we had of crashing when sharing a file on iOS 8 is a tendency that has been tamed.
- Fixed: Weâ€™ve improved the way @mentions and #channel-names autocomplete, so they no longer push messages up as they magically resolve themselves.
- Fixed: Even if you had already edited an image from your camera roll, a decision to â€œUse Last Photo Takenâ€ would use the original image instead of the edited version.
- Fixed: The Watch app no longer crashes for users on large teams, and loads faster than ever for those on teams of all sizes.
- Fixed: Channels with unread messages would sometimes get stuck in a â€œreadâ€ state on iPad. Now everything youâ€™ve read is read and everything you havenâ€™t read is unread, as nature intended. Apart from the things that you have read but then have chosen to mark as unread with a long press, but thatâ€™s a different matter entirely.
- Fixed: The screen is now scrollable when editing your own profile, and no part of the page now plays partial peekaboo behind the keyboard.
list.title: Slack - Team Communication
list.os_requirements: Requires iOS 8.0 or later. Compatible with iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.
